author: Gimly
body:
<!-- Anything that looks like this is a comment and can't be seen after the Pull Request is created. -->

# PR Summary

The System.Management.Automation.Utils.GetEncoding method should return UTF8 without BOM as a default but was returning ASCII.

This is fixed by returning an instance of the Utf8Encoding with the BOM set to false as a default fallback encoding.
<!-- Summarize your PR between here and the checklist. -->

## PR Context

This should fix #13678 and fix partially #13677

comments.author: rjmholt
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee please review this potentially breaking change, noting the linked issues

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
For PowerShell-Committee:
- it affects only transcribe output files.
- we already changed defaults to Uft8NoBOM in other code paths
- I think it is a bug and we shouldn't consider this as a breaking change - it is unexpected behavior if we change encoding of existent file.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: ASCII being a subset of UTF8 makes this an unlikely impactful breaking change (bucket 3) for me.  Seems like the right thing to do.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee reviewed this, we agree that this is a bucket 3 breaking change that is unlikely to have negative impact on anyone.  This should have been changed along with the other encoding changes to UTF-8 by default and is a bug fix.
